name: Append text blocks (paragraphs, headings, lists)
description: Append text blocks (paragraphs, headings, lists) to a Notion page. This is the most commonly used action for adding content to Notion. Use for: documentation, notes, articles, outlines, lists. Supported block types: - paragraph: Regular text - heading_1, heading_2, heading_3: Section headers - bulleted_list_item: Bullet points - numbered_list_item: Numbered lists ⚠️ Text content is limited to 2000 characters per text.content field. For other block types, use specialized actions: - append_task_blocks: to-do, toggle, callout - append_code_blocks: code, quote, equation - append_media_blocks: image, video, audio, files - append_layout_blocks: divider, columns, TOC - append_table_blocks: tables

input_parameters.description: Request model for appending text blocks to a Notion page.

after.description: Optional UUID of an existing child block. New blocks will be inserted after this block.
after.title: After

block_id.description: The UUID of the parent block or page to append children to.
block_id.title: Block Id

children.description:
Array of text block objects to append (also accepts 'blocks' as parameter name). Supported types:
- paragraph: Regular text paragraph
- heading_1, heading_2, heading_3: Section headings
- bulleted_list_item: Bullet point
- numbered_list_item: Numbered list item

⚠️ Text content limited to 2000 characters per rich_text text.content field.
Max 100 blocks per request.

color.description: Color of the paragraph text or background.
color.title: BlockColor

rich_text.description: Array of rich text objects. Each text.content is limited to 2000 chars.

items.description: Rich text object for creating text content in blocks.

anyOf.description: Text styling annotations for rich text.

code.description: Whether the text is formatted as inline code.
code.title: Code

color.description: Color of the text or background.
color.title: BlockColor

anyOf.title: TextAnnotations

annotations.description: Optional text styling annotations (bold, italic, etc.).

content.description: The actual text content. CRITICAL: Maximum 2000 characters per text object.
examples: This is a paragraph of text.
content.title: Content

url.description: The URL the text links to.
url.title: Url

type.description: Type of rich text. Currently only 'text' is supported for input.
type.title: Type

items.title: RichTextInput

rich_text.title: Rich Text

is_toggleable.description: Whether the heading can be toggled to show/hide content.
is_toggleable.title: Is Toggleable

block.description: Empty object corresponding to the type field.
block.title: Block

has_more.description: Whether there are more results available beyond this page.
has_more.title: Has More

next_cursor.title: Next Cursor

results.description: Array of newly created block objects that were appended as children.

items.description: Notion block object returned in the results array.

anyOf.description: Partial user object representing a Notion user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user (UUID format).
id.title: Id

anyOf.title: PartialUser

created_by.description: Partial user object representing the user who created the block.
created_by.title: Created By

created_time.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the block was created.
created_time.title: Created Time

has_children.description: Whether the block has child blocks nested within it.
has_children.title: Has Children

id.description: Unique identifier for the block (UUID v4 format).
id.title: Id

in_trash.description: Whether the block is in the trash.
in_trash.title: In Trash

anyOf.description: Partial user object representing a Notion user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user (UUID format).
id.title: Id

anyOf.title: PartialUser

last_edited_by.title: Last Edited By

last_edited_time.title: Last Edited Time

block_id.title: Block Id

data_source_id.title: Data Source Id

page_id.description: UUID of the parent page (when type is 'page_id').
page_id.title: Page Id
